title: Reduced Tillage Systems for Organic Vegetable Production

tasks.task: Conduct research on reduced tillage systems for organic vegetable production.
subtasks: Seeding cover crops (rye and vetch) at specific rates and dates.
Allow cover crops to grow through fall and spring.
Use a roller crimper to terminate cover crops when rye is at anthesis and vetch is in early pod stage.
Implement three whole plot treatments (no-till, strip-till, conventional till) in the study.
Subdivide each whole plot into two subplots to test two nitrogen fertilization strategies.
Apply nitrogen fertilizer either all at once or split between pre-plant and fertigation.
Monitor nitrate leaching using lysimeters and collect data.
Compare yields between no-till, strip-till, and conventional till treatments.

tasks.task: Discuss equipment and techniques used in the study.
subtasks: Describe the rolled crimper's design and operation.
Explain the function of the Hineker 6000 strip tiller's components (row cleaners, coulter, subsoil shank, side dressing unit, rolling basket).
Outline the process of using the strip tiller in the fall and pre-planting stages.

tasks.task: Present observed data and preliminary findings.
subtasks: Note higher nitrate leaching in conventional till plots compared to no-till and strip-till.
Hypothesize that no-till and strip-till can achieve comparable yields to conventional till.
Mention ongoing monitoring of weed control and crop health in different systems.
